question: Gram Positive Bacteria can be identified by the Gram staining because of the following reasons?
option1: The cell walls have more lipids compared to peptidoglycan
option2: The Cells walls have more Peptidoglycan compared to Lipids
option3: The Cells membrane has more fatty acids
answer: The Cells walls have more Peptidoglycan compared to Lipids
explanation: The cell wall which is made up of Peptidoglycan as well as lipids gets violet due to the reaction of the CV+. After the decolorization with alcohol, the lipids gets dissolved and the bacteria with higher Peptidoglycan remain violet. These are called Gram Positive bacteria.
